page.title: 05A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: {Mr. Wallace,Farrows Farm, Ashwell. The working day starts at 7a.m.On this July day he first saw his arable man to prepare the combine harvester for gathering winter barley and routine servicing and his 2 pigmen. He loaded culled sows to take to slaughter and then paid the pickers in the soft fruit fields. Some business work took him to{"beaver":an}Ashwell term for break at 9:30. At 10a.m. he opened the farm caravan to sell produce and then did some maintenance work and repairs before doing 2 hours{office}work. This takes up more and more time. The afternoon was spent checking the fruit fields and taking samples of winter wheat.The day usually ends at 4 p.m. though there is summer {overtime.}The farm has been in his family since around 1650.
